page.title: 10Parish of St. John Baptist.
page.content: The parish boundaries touch Blake Hall, Langley Lane, Blundell Brook, Whittingham Hospital, Cow Hill, then follow Savick Brook across Garstang Road to the railway line and north again to Blake Hall, with a parish population of 15,000. The original stone church of St. John Baptist to the east of Garstang Road has existed since 1112. St. Martin's Chapel on the west side has a parish hall and social club and St. Peter's Chapel doubles as the school hall. All 3 centres have weekly Family Communions and Sunday Schools. The Church choir leads Matins & Evensong. With an electoral roll of 683, activities include the uniformed Youth Organisations, Drama, Women's Fellowship, Bell Ringers, Bible Study, Mother's Union & confirmation groups. Over 200 take communion on average. Two parish schools educate 490 pupils.
